intro: Eupritchardia remota, commonly known as the remote eupritchardia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eupritchardia remota is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
